sections.title: Real Stories. Real Momentum.
sections.subhead: Experiences from Black founders building toward ownership.
body: Stories motivate when they are honest. We share stories to show what building actually looks like: the decisions, the uncertainty, the progress, and the moments that change direction.
These stories help us feel less alone and more confident in our next steps. They remind us that momentum is built over time.

image.alt: Portrait framed by soft light and layered textiles.

sections.title: Experience Shared Honestly
body: Cupcakes + Broccoli is shaped by real people navigating real decisions.
Founders, collaborators, and Amanda reflect on what building actually looks like. The choices. The uncertainty. The moments that change direction.
These stories are not performance. They are perspective.

sections.title: Many Forms of Story
body: Stories at Cupcakes + Broccoli take many forms. You may find:
list: Reflections by Amanda on ownership, work, and decision-making
Stories from Black founders navigating growth, transition, and uncertainty
Perspectives from collaborators who have worked closely with Amanda
Essays on building inside systems that were not designed for us
bodyAfter: Each story exists to offer clarity, not polish.

sections.title: Context, Connection, Momentum
body: Building can be isolating, especially when decisions are carried alone.
Stories help create context. They remind us that uncertainty is part of the work and that momentum is built over time.
They create connection without performance. This is where shared experience lives.

sections.eyebrow: How Stories Connect to the Work
sections.title: Stories Inform the Platform
body: Stories do not stand apart from the platform. They inform it.
Many stories connect directly to learning resources, consulting insights, member conversations, or Blind Dinners. Together, they add depth and perspective.

inlineLink.label: Explore practical tools inspired by these stories

sections.title: Connection That Continues
body: Some stories grow out of real connection.
Blind Dinners are invitation-based gatherings where Black founders come together for honest conversation. While the dinners themselves are private, the reflections they inspire often live here.

sections.title: Public Stories and Deeper Access
body: Some stories are shared publicly. Others are reserved for members.
Membership makes space for deeper reflection, trust, and care.

sections.title: Read the Stories
body: If you are looking for perfectly packaged success stories, this may not be the right place.
If you are looking for honesty, context, and shared experience from people building toward ownership, you are welcome here.
